comments:
I installed the 0314 build.
Imported all of the plugins as binary projects
Opened a connection to a local cvs repostiory and checked out one project 
(benchmarks)

Noticed complaint about classpath being wrong on the benchmark project.
Noticed that JRE binding was not set either so I went to the preferences

Opened the Installed/JRE page and the following exeption was logged:
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDebugOptionsManager$3.run(JavaD
ebugOptionsManager.java:270)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1292
)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDebugOptionsManager$5.run(JavaD
ebugOptionsManager.java:649)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)


Now come the fun part. I exited the workbench to try to recreate the defect and 
provide simpler steps.

   -> No exception when opening the Installed JRE page

   -> Errors went away when I did a "Rebuild All"
I got this same stack dump starting up a workspace that had crashed.

D:\sdk20020328\eclipse>d:\jdk1.3.1_01\jre\bin\java -verify -cp startup.jar org.e
clipse.core.launcher.UIMain -application org.eclipse.ui.workbench -debug -data d
:\eclipse_dev\plugins
Startup: using configuration file:/D:/sdk20020328/eclipse/install/platform.cfg
Boot URL:
    file:D:/sdk20020328/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.boot/boot.jar
Install URL: file:D:/sdk20020328/eclipse/
Debug-Options: file:D:/sdk20020328/eclipse/.options
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDebugOptionsManager$3.run(JavaD
ebugOptionsManager.java:267)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1343
)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDebugOptionsManager$5.run(JavaD
ebugOptionsManager.java:666)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)
*** Bug 12734 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The problem:
The JDIDebugUIPlugin starts up
The JavaDebugOPtionsManager is started up.
In initialize, the manager creates a workspace runnable and forks it off (T1).
Then the manager starts dealing with the problems in the workspace 
(problemAdded).  This creates a workspace runnable and forks it off (T2).  
There is no guarantee that T1 will run before T2.

Once possible solution is to put dealing with the problems in the same 
workspace runnable of T1 (special code for the startup).

A lot going on here...see bug 12001.

Fixed. Creation of "compilation problem" and "uncaught excpetion" breakpoints 
is deferred until the first launch, or when one of the preferences is 
explicitly changed. As well, the creation of the cache of existing compilation 
problems is delayed. This lazy approach reduces startup processing and avoids 
the problem described in this bug.
